title: Dietmar Hamann says Liverpool owners are stuck in the past and need a "reality check"
text:
Sport Dietmar Hamann says Liverpool owners are stuck in the past and need a "reality check" The Reds are one of the world's most popular football teams but Hamann believes that their stock is not what once was Share Liverpool's owners have been told to have a reality check (Photo: Reuters) Share Get Liverpool FC     
Former Liverpool midfielder Didi Hamann has warned Anfield bosses they need a “reality check”. 
German Hamann is worried the Reds believe they are stuck in the past and think they are still the biggest club in the country - due to their illustrious history and worldwide fans. 
He believes Jurgen Klopp was chosen to completely turn the Merseyside outfit from their Premier League struggles back to their heyday. 
"My worry is that over the last six, seven, eight years there’s been numerous managers there and I think now with this appointment they’ve got one of the top managers in Europe and he needs support,” Hamann said to Paddy Power. 
"He’s changes a few things in a short space of time, but if you think only by appointing the manager that things will come good – you’re wrong. Hamann during a 2016 Liverpool legends game (Photo: B Kanaris/Liverpool FC via Getty) Read More Hamann criticises Jurgen Klopp's decision not to sign a left-back 
"The club needs a reality check. Part of the problem at Liverpool is that, because the club creates so much interest all over the world, people still seem to think that they’re still one of the driving forces in Europe – which they’re not! 
"I think that’s the biggest problem is where people within the club, and I include the players, perceive the club to be and where they actually are - because there’s a huge gap. 
"This is what the manager is fighting now, to change the mentality not only in the team, but in the whole club. Everyone needs to work 100% harder to get Liverpool back to where they were.
